benefits are great for a nonprofit

review_title: Poor leadership hurts a great organization
pros: Most of the people are very nice and genuine.  They have a desire to help their customers enjoy healthier lives while simultaneously enjoying a friendly environment.
cons: Unethical management who steal or misuse the resources to line their own pockets or take fancy trips, buy cars, etc.  Plus, inequitable pay structure and an unrealistic expectation for you to do more than you're paid to do. They take advantage of their employees and want to demand the world if you get a 25-cent raise while treating themselves to luxurious trips. It boils down to really bad leadership.

job_title: Director of IT in Fresno, CA
pros:
Great committed staff to the organizations core mission.
Life-Saving centralized emergency data available 24/7 365 days a year with certified mid-level staff.
cons:
Executives pilfering of Organizations funds.
Constant bickering and back stabbing at the management and Wxecutive levels, prevents the organization from growing to deliver the Life-Saving services.
Reasoning for attendance of certain conferences were at oral waste of financial resources instead of being used to advance the Organizations Mission.

job_title: Customer Service Representative in Turlock, CA
pros: The restrooms are clean and the landscaping is beautiful.
cons: From the Call Center floor - If you enjoy working with supervisor and management types that are very, very good at sending urgent emails throughout the day marked with the red exclamation points that start with, "In an effort to...", then this is the place for you.   If you would rather work with actual leaders that get things done, then please look elsewhere.   Remember, there is a big difference between a manager and a leader.

review_title: Positive corporate culture and satisfying mission.
pros:
Pay is good for the work done
Benifits are outstanding for the area
Mission is one I can support completely
Co-workers are generally great to work with
positive corporate culture
cons: Amorphous company policies that, when left open to interpretation, allow senior management to rid themselves of anyone who disagrees with them.

pros: The employees are all very nice and easy to get along with.
cons: Lack of experienced management.  Lack of opportunity and ongoing training and education.

pros: the people are dedicated to saving lives of the membership and are fun to work with
